outfits.name: afterburner afterburner 1.0 15
outfits.description: This is an engine additive of a company named FlarePlay. An engine exhaust coloration appears when additives like strontium, copper, cesium or others are introduced, burning at high temperatures and emitting vivid colors... red from strontium, green from copper, blue from cesium. The result is a striking exhaust plume used for flight shows, research on combustion efficiency, or just to let your spaceship look cool. Due to varying engine characteristics, additives are limited to their designated propulsion systems: afterburner flare for afterburners, reverse flare for reverse thrusters, steering flare for steering thrusters, and standard flare for primary thrusters. You don't know what it means or if it is important, but on the package you can read: 'afterburner sc:1.0/fr:15'

An engine exhaust coloration appears when additives like strontium, copper, cesium or others are introduced, burning at high temperatures and emitting vivid colors... red from strontium, green from copper, blue from cesium. The result is a striking exhaust plume used for flight shows, research on combustion efficiency, or just to let your spaceship look cool. Due to varying engine characteristics, additives are limited to their designated propulsion systems: afterburner flare for afterburners, reverse flare for reverse thrusters, steering flare for steering thrusters, and standard flare for primary thrusters. The result is a striking exhaust plume used for flight shows, research on combustion efficiency, or just to let your spaceship look cool. An engine exhaust coloration appears when additives like strontium, copper, cesium or others are introduced, burning at high temperatures and emitting vivid colors... red from strontium, green from copper, blue from cesium. The result is a striking exhaust plume used for flight shows, research on combustion efficiency, or just to let your spaceship look cool. Due to varying engine characteristics, additives are limited to their designated propulsion systems: afterburner flare for afterburners, reverse flare for reverse thrusters, steering flare for steering thrusters, and standard flare for primary thrusters. You don't know what it means or if it is important, but on the package you can read: 'wanderer flare/large sc:1.0/fr:18'
